Ingredients: To a mixing bowl, add 2/3 cup (165 ml) yogurt, ¾ teaspoon salt, 1 to 1½ teaspoon red chili powder, 1 to 1½ teaspoon biryani masala ¼
cooking-method: Biryani is prepared by layering parboiled basmati rice, marinated or cooked meat/chicken, fried onions, fresh herbs, lemon juice, saffron water

Ingredients: 2 cups Gobindobhog Chal (Small grain rice),1 large Onion,500 g shona moog dal (small-grained moong), ‍500 g aged gobindobhog rice‍, 320 g Bengali-style ghee (see notes)‍, 65 g cashew nuts
cooking-method: Bhuna khichuri recipe is an exemplary moong dal khichuri which is immensely popular in Bangladesh, West Bengal and few other parts of north east India. The texture of bhuna khichuri is completely different from other khichuri recipes. It is dry and grainy in texture exactly like pulao with extraordinary taste and flavour. In this preparation, gobindobhog chaal (Small grain rice) and shona moong dal (Split yellow lentils) are fried together and then cooked in hot water with some specific spices and fried onions.

Ingredients: ½ cup cooking oil, 1 medium onion, poppy seed, rice, garam masala
cooking-method: In a bowl, prepare the chicken marinade by whisking together yogurt, coriander powder, red chili powder, 1/2 tsp salt, and pulao seasoning mix. Mix in a splash of water. Add the chicken to the marinade, combine well, and let rest for 30 minutes.

cooking-method: 1Wash & clean the meat pieces. Drain water well. 2Make biryani spices mix. For this in a grinder take star anise, black cardamom.

Ingredients: prawns and coconut milk, along with ghee or mustard oil, onions, turmeric powder, chopped green chilli, garlic paste, and ginger paste flavoured with spices
cooking-method: he hard shells of the prawns are removed and marinated with sesame seeds and posto seeds (which are made into a paste). The prawns are then fried in hot oil along with onion, ginger, garlic, and stirred with turmeric and sugar and salt and coconut milk for a few minutes.

Ingredients: Made with flour, suger syrup, oil, salt, beson
cooking-method: Traditionally, the jalebi recipe is made with a batter of all purpose flour, gram flour (besan), baking soda and water that is fermented for several hours. The fermented batter is then poured in concentric circles in hot oil and deep-fried. These fried spirals are then soaked in a flavored sugar syrup and served.

Ingredients: Cow Belly/Bhuri - 1 kg , Onion chopped - 1 cup, Onion paste - 1/3 cup, Ginger paste - 1 tbsp ,Garlic paste - 1 tbsp
cooking-method: Wash the belly well after bringing it from the market. Now boil the cow belly for 10-15 minutes with 2 cups of water and 1 teaspoon of turmeric in a pan to remove the smell. For this keep the stove on high heat. No need to add more water. There are two benefits to cooking in this way. One is that the odor will come out from the stomach and the dirt attached to the stomach will also be removed. Now wash the belly again properly. After washing, grind to a slightly larger size for cooking. The pieces will become smaller after cooking.

Ingredients: milk, noodles, sugar, chocolate syrap, sweet besel sweets
cooking-method: It has origins in the Persian dish faloodeh, variants of which are found across West, Central, and South Asia. Traditionally it is made by mixing rose syrup, vermicelli, and sweet basil seeds with milk, often served with ice cream.
